title: SET U-vs-x graph set - what does particle A do

content.description: The variable <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> represents the position of Particle <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> in a two-particle system. Particle <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi> </math> is held at rest at the origin. The graph shows potential energy <math alttext="U" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>U</mi></math> of the two-particle system as a function of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math>. No external forces are exerted on the two-particle system.
content.question: If the total energy of the system is <math alttext="negative 1.0 joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The system has zero potential energy.

Particle <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has <math alttext="1.0 joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math> of kinetic energy.

Particle <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is always at <math alttext="x equals 0.40 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>.

Particle <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> oscillates between <math alttext="x equals 0.15 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.15</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and <math alttext="x equals 0.78 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.78</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>.

content.answer: Particle <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> oscillates between <math alttext="x equals 0.15 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.15</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and <math alttext="x equals 0.78 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.78</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
